Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature through your app (embedded signing)
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope, then uses embedded signing for the first signer. With embedded signing, DocuSign signing is initiated from your website.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: This example sends an envelope and then uses embedded signing for the first signer. With embedded signing, the DocuSign signing experience is initiated from your website.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with a remote (email) signer and cc recipient
Examples.ExampleDescription: The envelope includes a pdf, Word, and HTML document. Anchor text(AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
The envelope includes three documents: one each in PDF, Word, and HTML format. Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.

This is a general example of creating and sending an envelope (a signing request) to multiple recipients, with multiple documents, and with signature fields for the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: List envelopes in the user's account
Examples.ExampleDescription: List the envelopes created in the last 30 days.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
This example lists the envelopes whose status has changes within the last 30 days.

This example demonstrates how to query DocuSign about envelopes sent by the current user.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the Envelopes::listStatusChanges method:

Examples.ExampleName: Get an envelope's basic information and status
Examples.ExampleDescription: List the basic information about an envelope, including its overall status. Additional API/SDK methods may be used to get additional information about the envelope, its documents, recipients, etc.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
This example lists the basic information about an envelope, including its overall status. Additional API/SDK methods may be used to get additional information about the envelope, its documents, recipients, and more.

This example demonstrates how to obtain the latest information about an envelope from DocuSign. Often an alternative is to use Connect to enable DocuSign to send your application updates proactively when the status of an envelope changes.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the Envelopes::get method:

Examples.ExampleName: List an envelope's recipients and their status
Examples.ExampleDescription: List the envelope's recipients, including their current status.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: This example lists the envelope's recipients, including their current status.

Examples.ExampleName: List an envelope's documents
Examples.ExampleDescription: List the envelope's documents. A Certificate of Completion document is also associated with every envelope.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
This example lists the envelope's documents. A Certificate of Completion document is also associated with every envelope.

This method is often used to create a list of an envelope's documents dynamically in preparation for enabling your user to download one or more of the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the EnvelopeDocuments::list method:

Examples.ExampleName: Download a document from an envelope
Examples.ExampleDescription: An envelope's documents can be downloaded one by one or as a complete set.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
An envelope's documents can be downloaded one by one or as a complete set.

Document download options:

  • Combined: a PDF with the combined content of all documents and the certificate
  • ZIP archive: a ZIP archive that contains all of the PDF documents, the certificate, and any .WAV files used for voice authentication.
  • The envelope's individual documents
  • The envelope's Certificate of Completion

Examples.ExampleName: Create a template
Examples.ExampleDescription: Create a template with two roles, signer and cc.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
This example creates a template with two roles, signer and cc.The template includes three documents.

Templates are usually created using the DocuSign web tool. This example creates a template that will later be used by other examples in this launcher.

This example first lists the user's templates and only creates a new template if one does not already exist in your account.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Template name: {0}, ID {1}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope using a template
Examples.ExampleDescription: The envelope is defined by the template. The signer and cc recipient name and email are used to fill in the template's roles.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
The envelope is defined by the template. The signer and cc recipient name and email are used to fill in the template's roles.

This example demonstrates a common pattern for DocuSign integrations: envelopes will be sent programmatically, based on a template. If the template definition needs to be updated, the DocuSign web UI can be used to easily update the template, thus avoiding the need to make software changes.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope using binary document transfer
Examples.ExampleDescription:
The envelope includes a pdf, Word, and HTML document.

Multipart data transfer is used to send the documents in binary format to DocuSign. Binary transfer is 33% more efficient than base64 encoding and is recommended for documents over 15M Bytes. Binary transfer is not yet supported by the SDK.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
The envelope includes three documents: one each in PDF, Word, and HTML format.

Multipart data transfer is used to send the documents in binary format to DocuSign. Binary transfer is 33% more efficient than Base64 encoding and is recommended for documents over 15M Bytes.

Since binary transfer is not yet supported by the SDK, this example uses the API directly and demonstrates how to do so.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Embedded sending
Examples.ExampleDescription: An envelope will be created in draft mode. The DocuSign web tool (NDSE) will then be shown, enabling further updates to the envelope before it is sent.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
An envelope will be created in draft mode. The DocuSign UI will then be shown, enabling further updates to the envelope before it is sent.

The envelope includes three documents: one each in PDF, Word, and HTML format. Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.

DocuSign recommends that you enhance your application as needed to avoid the need for the embedded sender view. For example, if the sender view is used to optionally add additional documents to the envelope, enhance your app to provide the needed feature (see example 13 for adding additional documents programmatically).
Examples.ResultsPageText: Sender view URL: {0}

Examples.ExampleName: Embedded DocuSign web tool
Examples.ExampleDescription: Redirect the user to the DocuSign web tool.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
Redirect the user to the DocuSign UI.

Use this API call to open the DocuSign UI with the user already logged in. The starting view can be either an envelope's documents or the web tool's front page.

The user does not necessarily return from the DocuSign UI, so using this API call is often a final step for your application; or you can open the DocuSign UI in a new tab for the user.
Examples.ResultsPageText: NDSE view URL: {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Embedded Signing Ceremony from a template with an added document
Examples.ExampleDescription:
This example sends an envelope based on a template.

In addition to the template's document(s), the example adds an additional document to the envelope by using the Composite Templates feature.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
This example sends an envelope based on a template. In addition to the template's document(s), the example adds an additional document to the envelope by using the Composite Templates feature.

In this example, the additional document is an HTML document that includes order details with information from the form below. This example then enables you to sign the envelope using embedded signing.

In addition to the template's document(s), the example adds an additional document to the envelope by using the Composite Templates feature.

In this example, the additional document is an HTML document that includes order details with information from the form below.

This example then enables you to sign the envelope using embedded signing.

Embedded signing provides a smoother user experience for a signer who is already logged into your web application since the DocuSign signing ceremony is initiated from your website.
Examples.PageTitle: Use embedded signing from template and extra doc

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope to an In Person Signer
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to host an In Person Signing session with embedded signing.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: Demonstrates how to host an In Person Signing session with embedded signing.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with an order form and payment field
Examples.ExampleDescription: Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the fields in the documents.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
Note: This example will only work if the sender's DocuSign account is set up with a DocuSign payment gateway. Since the Payment Gateway ID is set in the configuration file, you will need to run your own instance of this project to set it.

Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the fields in the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Get the tab data from an envelope
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example retrieves the tab (field) values from an envelope.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
Get the tab (field) values from an envelope for all of the envelope's recipients.

This method is used to read the updated tab values from the envelope. The method can be used after the envelope is complete or while it is still in progress.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the Envelopes::get method:

Examples.ExampleName: Set tab values for a envelope
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example sets the tab (field) values for an envelope including tabs that can and cannot be changed by the signer.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
This example sets the tab (field) values for an envelope, including tabs that can and cannot be changed by the signer.

The example also sets custom metadata in the envelope via the envelope custom fields feature.

Examples.ExampleName: Set template tab values
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example sets the tab (field) values for a template being used by an envelope.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
This example sets the tab (field) values for a template being used by an envelope. It includes setting radio button and checkbox tabs.

The example also sets custom metadata in the envelope via the envelope custom fields feature.

Examples.ExampleName: List envelope custom metadata field values
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example lists the envelope's custom metadata field values.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended:
Get the data values associated with the envelope itself. The custom data fields enable you to add additional metadata to the envelope. The custom data fields can be set by the Sender via the DocuSign UI, or can be set programmatically. The data can be included in the envelope's certificate of completion.

This method is used to read the custom field values from an envelope.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the EnvelopeCustomFields::list method:

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with Access Code Recipient Authentication
Examples.ExampleDescription: Submit an envelope with an access code for multi-factor authentication.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: This example sends an envelope requiring the recipient to enter an access code for multifactor authentication. The envelope includes a PDF document. Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Require Phone Authentication for a Recipient
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope that requires entering a six-digit code from a text message or phone call for the purpose of multifactor authentication.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: This example sends an envelope requiring the recipient enter a code received via an SMS message for multifactor authentication. The envelope includes a PDF document. Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with Recipient Knowledged Based Authentication
Examples.ExampleDescription: Submit an envelope with multiple choice, public records based questions to provide multi-factor authentication.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: This example sends an envelope requiring the recipient answer multiple-choice, public records–based questions for multifactor authentication. The envelope includes a PDF document. Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with ID Verification Authentication
Examples.ExampleDescription: Submit an envelope that requires verification of a government issued identity.
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: This example sends an envelope requiring the recipient authenticate themselves by electronically presenting a government-issued identification (such as a passport, driver's license, or e-ID). The envelope includes a PDF document. Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Create a new Brand
Examples.ExampleDescription: Create a new Brand
Examples.ExampleDescriptionExtended: This example creates an account brand that can be used to apply customization to your envelopes, including your own logo, colors, and text elements. The brand includes a Brand Name; see Configure Brands on the Support Center.

Examples.ExampleName: Bulk send envelopes
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to send envelopes in bulk to multiple recipients. First, this example creates a bulk-send recipients list, then creates an envelope. After that, it initiates bulk envelope sending.
